PAD_DefeatCaptain.synopsis: After defeating the captain, this PAD plays to nudge the player to investigate further (towards the Inquisitor).
PAD_DefeatCaptain.how_to_trigger: Defeat the captain in a fight.

BarrierDeviceDialog.synopsis: In gameplay the player has inserted the key (stub name |Gith Shard|) into the barrier control device in the captain's office. The device turns on, and connects the palyer to the Inquisitor, who speaks through the device (voice only). If the Captain is still alive, she tries to interrupt, but the Inquisitor allows the players in.
BarrierDeviceDialog.how_to_trigger: 1) Go to 1353; 2; -773 and watch the dialog between the Captain and Templar. 2) Then set roll amazing, sneak behind the Captain and steal the item in her inventory (stub name |Gith Shard|). 3) Use the door device and insert the Shard. The dialog will start.

AD_CaptainSendsPlayerToInquisitior.synopsis: An AD the captain says after she opens the barrier for the player.
AD_CaptainSendsPlayerToInquisitior.how_to_trigger: Go to 1357; 0; -766 in CRE_Main_A and talk to the captain. Show her the artefact, and have her open the barrier for you. After the dialog ends, she will say the AD.

AD_ThirdTurn.synopsis:
Full context from combat - we’d like to request some voicebarks for Captain Therezzyn combat in Creche

Therezzyn’s second turn (first one she calls for the guards)

Therezzyn: You die here and by my sword, intruder!

Therezzyn’s third turn

Therezzyn: Die already! I won’t be embarrassed in front of my troops again!
AD_ThirdTurn.how_to_trigger: Go to the creche > captain's quarters > start combat

AD_InquisitorAdmitsPlayer.synopsis: The Inquisitor speaks through the door communicator located in the captain's office when the player interacts with it, admitting the player through.

CaptainWarning.synopsis: The Captain reprimands the player for trying to just walk away after presenting her with the artefact. The player is warned not to walk out of the room. If they try again, they will be attacked.
CaptainWarning.how_to_trigger: Load up CRE_Main_Ago to 1392; -2; -772wait for the cinematic to endtalk to the captain and show her the artefacttry to leave the room through the front door

Captain.synopsis: Captain Therezzyn of Creche Yllek interrogates the player about the missing githyanki "weapon". We should learn:1. The githyanki's missing weapon and our artefact are THE SAME2. the githyanki were planning to attack moonrise towers
Captain.how_to_trigger: Get spotted by the captain after the CaptainTemplarDialog finishes.Complete the Zaithisk dialogue to unlock all options.

AD_SecondTurn.synopsis:
Full context from combat - we’d like to request some voicebarks for Captain Therezzyn combat in Creche

Therezzyn’s second turn (first one she calls for the guards)

Therezzyn: You die here and by my sword, intruder!

Therezzyn’s third turn

Therezzyn: Die already! I won’t be embarrassed in front of my troops again!
AD_SecondTurn.how_to_trigger: Go to the creche > captain's quarters > start combat

GithGuardMonastery01.synopsis: The guard is apprehensive about the captain's mood right now - the hunt for the weapon isn't going well.
GithGuardMonastery01.how_to_trigger: Speak to the GithGuard01 after the Cultist Capture Scene outside of the captain's office.

GithGuardMonastery02.how_to_trigger: Speak to the GithGuard02 after the Cultist Capture Scene. If we skip the Cultist Capture scene, they don't show up.

AD_CultistCapture.synopsis: Two gith gloat over a group of cultists, one of which has fallen to the ground while being frogmarched to the Captain. They kick him where he's fallen.
AD_CultistCapture.how_to_trigger: Approach the main door to the monastery, without triggering the dialogue.

AD_CaptainCallsGuards.synopsis: Captain calls the patrolling guard for help when combat starts.

PAD_CaptainsMapComment.synopsis: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react to interacting with the map in the Captain's office. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
PAD_CaptainsMapComment.how_to_trigger: Load up CRE_Main_AGo to 1392; -2; -772interact with the parchment on the wall

PAD_DoorDeviceInteraction.synopsis: The player attempts to interact with the door communicator in the Captain's Office after having talked to the inquisitor. Demonstrating no more interactivity with device.
PAD_DoorDeviceInteraction.how_to_trigger: Approach the door communicator at 1354; 1; -764 and interact with it. Once the Templar opens it for you, interact with it again, to trigger the Voicebark.

AD_CaptainRealizesTheft.synopsis: The captain tries to let the player in through the barrier in her office, but the player has already pickpocketed the key off her. She immediately suspects the outsiders, and turns hostile on them.
AD_CaptainRealizesTheft.how_to_trigger: 1) Go to 1353; 2; -773 and watch the dialog between the Captain and Templar. 2) Then set roll amazing, sneak behind the Captain and steal the item in her inventory (stub name |Gith Shard|). 3) Talk to the captain, and convince her to let you in to the templar (roll amazing will help)She will walk to the door control and say the line, then turn hostile.

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar.synopsis: The player overhears a conversation between Captain Therezzyn and the Templar. The Templar blames the captain for not having found the weapon yet and leaves.
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar.how_to_trigger: In the upper creche, after passing the guards' check, go straight on through the big doors. Dialogue will trigger when the door is opened.

AD_CaptainOrdersToCloseDoor.synopsis: Captain commands for the door to be closed.
AD_CaptainOrdersToCloseDoor.how_to_trigger: Plays after the CaptainSpeaksToTemplar dialog is over.

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.synopsis: Used for building up the moment when the player meets the templar.
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.how_to_trigger: Plays if the player goes to the templar alone or with their party.

PAD_DefeatCaptain_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DefeatCaptain_0.text: Well that's dealt with. But she wasn't the one pulling the strings here.

BarrierDeviceDialog_0.speaker: Githyanki Barrier Disruptor
BarrierDeviceDialog_0.text: Who would be... Oh. It is you.
BarrierDeviceDialog_0.context: NodeContext: he says this with a creeping excitement as he realises who the player is

BarrierDeviceDialog_3.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
BarrierDeviceDialog_3.text: Is'tark... I will not have you sneaking through my crèche.

BarrierDeviceDialog_4.speaker: Githyanki Barrier Disruptor
BarrierDeviceDialog_4.text: Quiet, Therezzyn. I wish to speak with this one.

BarrierDeviceDialog_1.speaker: Githyanki Barrier Disruptor
BarrierDeviceDialog_1.text: Make haste. We have business to conduct.

AD_CaptainSendsPlayerToInquisitior_0.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_CaptainSendsPlayerToInquisitior_0.text: The Inquisitor awaits. Follow the corridor.

AD_CaptainSendsPlayerToInquisitior_1.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_CaptainSendsPlayerToInquisitior_1.text: Go. Down the hall. The Inquisitor awaits.

AD_ThirdTurn_0.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_ThirdTurn_0.text: You will not embarrass me anymore!

CaptainWarning_0.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainWarning_0.text: Where do you think you're going? Take the artefact to the Inquisitor. Now.

CaptainWarning_1.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainWarning_1.text: Any attempts to subvert me will result in your death.

Captain_46.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_46.text: I presume you are not stupid enough to return empty-handed. So give me the weapon - now.

Captain_173.speaker: Player
Captain_173.text: I've not found it yet - but I'm close. I just need more time.

Captain_51.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_51.text: Time is finite. As is my patience. Go.

Captain_74.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_74.text: Then our ghustil will study your corpse.

Captain_164.speaker: Lae'zel
Captain_164.text: Honoured kith'rak. May Vlaakith show us truth.

Captain_24.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_24.text: You are not familiar to me, ra'stil. Do you bring news of the weapon?

Captain_86.speaker: Player
Captain_86.text: Weapon? I seek aid. We should be fighting the ghaik incursion.

Captain_160.speaker: Player
Captain_160.text: Your sentries thought I could be of use to the Inquisitor.

Captain_0.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_0.text: Chk. A kith'rak's time is precious. Waste it at your peril.

Captain_71.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_71.text: Finish your business here, and leave.

Captain_97.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_97.text: You have returned. Any news of the weapon?

Captain_16.speaker: Player
Captain_16.text: What does this weapon look like?

Captain_42.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_42.text: Then squander my time no more. Go. Now.

Captain_104.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_104.text: An istik. In my crèche. You are one of the mercenaries sent to bring the weapon?
Captain_104.context: NodeContext: Isitk should be spat here, she is disgusted by you

Captain_147.speaker: Lae'zel
Captain_147.text: The istik is with me, honoured kith'rak.

Captain_158.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_158.text: So noted. But my question goes unanswered. Do you bring the weapon?

Captain_100.speaker: Player
Captain_100.text: I think I have what you're looking for.

Captain_47.speaker: Player
Captain_47.text: I believe I have found the weapon we seek.

Captain_81.speaker: Player
Captain_81.text: I seek audience with your Inquisitor. There's a traitor among you.

Captain_99.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_99.text: Chk - a strong accusation from the mouth of an istik. The very same said to hold the weapon we seek.

Captain_172.speaker: Player
Captain_172.text: That is only for your Inquisitor to know. Take me to him.

Captain_44.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_44.text: Chk - vague allegations and undue demands. A poor introduction for an unproven istik.

Captain_34.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_34.text: The very same said to hold the weapon we seek.

Captain_9.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_9.text: You are forbidden to leave. Report to the Inquisitor at once. Deliver the Prism.

Captain_57.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_57.text: Do not try to leave or it will be your death!

Captain_19.speaker: Player
Captain_19.text: Forgive me - I misspoke. There is no traitor.

Captain_28.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_28.text: Then learn to tame your tongue. I will ask one last time: have you brought the weapon?

Captain_77.speaker: Player
Captain_77.text: I was granted entry by your sentries. They told me to seek the Inquisitor.

Captain_116.speaker: Player
Captain_116.text: I'm to report to your infirmary for investigation.

Captain_3.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_3.text: Does this look like an infirmary?

Captain_149.speaker: Player
Captain_149.text: Can you give me a description of the weapon you seek?

Captain_151.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_151.text: Our healer's office is past the dormitories. Go, before I send you as a corpse.

Captain_32.speaker: Player
Captain_32.text: I have proof of the illithid invasion - it might help your Inquisitor to rethink his priorities.

Captain_135.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_135.text: We have all the proof we need and it has not moved his resolve.
Captain_135.context: NodeContext: with fatigue - she has tried this argument many times with the inquisitor and failed

Captain_25.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_25.text: Information. Chk. If it's not about the weapon we seek, I don't care.

Captain_166.text: I told you, they will stop at nothing to reclaim it.

Captain_84.speaker: Player
Captain_84.text: I know nothing about the weapon.

Captain_5.speaker: Player
Captain_5.text: I need a description of the weapon you seek.

Captain_65.speaker: Player
Captain_65.text: I was told to seek your infirmary.

Captain_163.speaker: Player
Captain_163.text: There's a mind flayer invasion in progress. Why is that not your priority?

Captain_27.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_27.text: You are well informed. My crèche discovered the same.

Captain_91.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_91.text: We know infected flock to Moonrise Towers. I reported the gathering masses back to Tu'narath.

Captain_175.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_175.text: In response, they sent an Inquisitor. Instead of ordering an assault, we were told to join in this mad hunt for an ancient relic.

Captain_96.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_96.text: Meanwhile, illithid sickness spreads right in front of us.

Captain_125.speaker: Player
Captain_125.text: What is so important about this weapon?

Captain_130.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_130.text: I do not know - this hunt is the Inquisitor's folly, not mine.

Captain_83.speaker: Player
Captain_83.text: What does this weapon look like?

Captain_118.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_118.text: Inquisitor W'wargaz has the Queen's ear, so we have no choice but to follow him in this folly.

Captain_63.speaker: Player
Captain_63.text: What is so important about this weapon?

Captain_43.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_43.text: But I cannot imagine this is what our queen wants.

Captain_111.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_111.text: Still, perhaps you've heard of it. Tell me, does this sound familiar?

Captain_133.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_133.text: It is small. Angular. Metal. Adorned with tir'su script. Stolen by 'True Soul' heretics.
Captain_133.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

Captain_144.speaker: Narrator
Captain_144.text: *She seeks the artefact you carry - the artefact now nestled in your pocket, that doesn't want to be relinquished.*

Captain_126.speaker: Narrator
Captain_126.text: *You realise she seeks the artefact you carry.*
Captain_126.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

Captain_68.speaker: Narrator
Captain_68.text: *You sense Shadowheart's worry. This 'weapon' sounds like the artefact you carry.*
Captain_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks at the player, deeply worried.

Captain_124.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_124.text: What was that look? You know something. Do you have it?

Captain_29.speaker: Player
Captain_29.text: I have what you're looking for.

Captain_20.speaker: Player
Captain_20.text: I have found the weapon we seek.

Captain_106.speaker: Shadowheart
Captain_106.text: I sincerely hope you know what you're doing...
Captain_106.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

Captain_152.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_152.text: Ch'mar zal'a Vlaakith! Give it to me.
Captain_152.context: NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith - means 'Vlaakith's will above all' - used in the way that we may say 'Praise the Lord!'

Captain_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player produces the artefact.

Captain_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: The captain moves her hand, psionic energy gathering. She closes her fist and pulls towards her. The artefact is pulled to the captain. She holds it suspended in the air with her psionics. It begins to glow

Captain_129.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_129.text: Yes - there it is. Exactly as described. The inquisition will finally come to an end.
Captain_129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Therezzyn studies the artefact suspended before her.

Captain_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: The artefact's glow pulses into a shockwave of energy, blasting the captain off her feet and propelling the artefact back to the player. The player picks it up.

Captain_110.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_110.text: Tsk'va! Trickery, heresy, how did you -
Captain_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: The captain scrambles to her feet after being knocked down by a blast from the artefact NodeContext: she gets into an angry rant and then rights herself, reallising it's not worth it

Captain_79.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_79.text: You manipulate it when I cannot?

Captain_78.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_78.text: It appears you have been chosen, istik. You are lucky it is not for me to question why.
Captain_78.context: NodeContext: bitter, envious, a bit sarcastic

Captain_114.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_114.text: Go, seek the Inquisitor below. And take the cursed thing with you.
Captain_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: The captain begins to walk towards the barrier device.

Captain_156.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_156.text: No? Then I will take it from your corpse.

Captain_123.speaker: Player
Captain_123.text: I don't know anything about it.

Captain_112.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_112.text: Then stop wasting my time, istik.

Captain_171.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_171.text: By command of the Inquisition, you are ordered to join in our search. Return with the weapon, or do not return at all.

Captain_139.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_139.text: You are one of the mercenaries we engaged, are you not?

Captain_155.speaker: Player
Captain_155.text: Of course. I will be back on the search immediately.

Captain_1.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_1.text: A fortune in gold, vouched for by our queen herself.

Captain_87.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_87.text: I have business to attend to. Return with the weapon, or do not return at all.

Captain_177.speaker: Player
Captain_177.text: Not exactly. I'm here to loot the place.

Captain_138.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_138.text: You are here to - no. You are here to die.

Captain_69.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_69.text: And yet your face betrays you. You found it, didn't you?

Captain_162.speaker: Player
Captain_162.text: What I know can only be heard by the Inquisitor. You must let me pass.

Captain_37.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_37.text: If you speak truth, the Inquisitor will reward you greatly. If you lie...

Captain_75.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_75.text: ...Well. Inquisitor W'wargaz will ensure you do not bother me again.
Captain_75.context: InternalNodeContext: BarrierDeactivated state flag on here temporarily until new scripting is submitted.

Captain_17.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_17.text: You would invoke rank? On a kith'rak? Pathetic, vin'iisk.

Captain_6.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_6.text: Only return if you have the weapon. I will not tolerate insubordination.

Captain_131.speaker: Player
Captain_131.text: If the Inquisition seeks this weapon, it must be vital. Tell me of it.

Captain_94.speaker: Player
Captain_94.text: Maybe I can help you find the weapon.

Captain_176.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_176.text: Tell me, istik, does this sound familiar?

Captain_107.speaker: Player
Captain_107.text: I am no mercenary, but I am a good tracker. Describe the weapon - I can help you.

Captain_31.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_31.text: Arrogance - a typical symptom of the istik condition. But an arrogant tracker is a tracker nonetheless.
Captain_31.context: NodeContext: superior, rude, insulting humans for being human

Captain_168.speaker: Player
Captain_168.text: To value a mere weapon so much is pure vanity. You should worry more about your warriors.

Captain_22.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_22.text: You are mistaken. The hunt for the weapon is the Inquisitor's folly, not mine - but it is not your place to question orders.

Captain_154.speaker: Player
Captain_154.text: Sure I have a weapon. Want to see your blood on it?

Captain_145.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_145.text: I'll gladly see you try. Htak'a!

Captain_134.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_134.text: Using my room as a thoroughfare is an indignity. Disturbing me is an insult. Begone.

Captain_140.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_140.text: You must have impressed him, to be let out so readily.
Captain_140.context: InternalNodeContext: 'him' is the Inquisitor. Captain doesn't know he's dead. NodeContext: with a hint of jealousy - she's not managed to impress the inquisitor yet

Captain_153.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain_153.text: You have orders. See them done.
Captain_153.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't like that you've got more important things to do than she does. NodeContext: slightly sulky

AD_SecondTurn_0.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_SecondTurn_0.text: You will die by my sword, chraith!

GithGuardMonastery01_0.speaker: Raider Add'ath
GithGuardMonastery01_0.text: If I need to speak to a creature like you, I will do so. Begone.

GithGuardMonastery01_1.speaker: Raider Add'ath
GithGuardMonastery01_1.text: Welcome, ra'stil. If you're looking for the Kith'rak, I would advise caution. Her patience hangs thin.

GithGuardMonastery01_2.speaker: Raider Add'ath
GithGuardMonastery01_2.text: I hope you bring good news for the kith'rak. Vlaakith help us if you don't.

GithGuardMonastery01_3.speaker: Raider Add'ath
GithGuardMonastery01_3.text: Another istik? You're lucky we didn't catch you outside, or you'd be in with the Captain right now.

GithGuardMonastery02_0.speaker: Warrior Ith'dul
GithGuardMonastery02_0.text: Yet again, the weapon eludes us. I've heard even Kith'rak Voss is searching now.

GithGuardMonastery02_1.speaker: Warrior Ith'dul
GithGuardMonastery02_1.text: The Captain has little patience for your kind. You'd better not waste her time.

GithGuardMonastery02_2.speaker: Warrior Ith'dul
GithGuardMonastery02_2.text: It is unusual for the Captain to spend so long thwarted. The Inquisitor expects results.

AD_CultistCapture_2.speaker: Warrior Ith'dul
AD_CultistCapture_2.text: If you make it inside, we might even kill you before the captain's pets do.

AD_CultistCapture_3.speaker: Burrock
AD_CultistCapture_3.text: Please. Just give me a moment!
AD_CultistCapture_3.context: InternalNodeContext: A gasped statement while being kicked.

AD_CultistCapture_4.speaker: Raider Add'ath
AD_CultistCapture_4.text: You're enjoying this, aren't you? Humiliation suits you.

AD_CultistCapture_6.speaker: Raider Add'ath
AD_CultistCapture_6.text: Pathetic. The fool cannot march without tripping over its own boots.

AD_CultistCapture_5.speaker: Burrock
AD_CultistCapture_5.text: No - please - if you'd just - stop!

PAD_CaptainsMapComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_CaptainsMapComment_0.text: A map of the Sword Coast? What are the gith planning?

PAD_DoorDeviceInteraction_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DoorDeviceInteraction_0.text: Looks like the barrier's turned off. Lucky me.

AD_CaptainRealizesTheft_0.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_CaptainRealizesTheft_0.text: Where is my key...? YOU. THIEF.

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_3.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_3.context:
CinematicNodeContext: 5 githyanki are in the room alongside the Captain and the Inquisitor. 
3 of them are pouring over maps, 2 are getting equipment ready.
The captain is adressing the inquisitor. 
The inquisitor stands in the door arch in the corner, almost shrouded by shadow,

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_8.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_8.text: The latest batch of cultists knew nothing of the Astral Prism. They were just trying to find Moonrise.

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_10.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_10.text: They all head there - my gish have drafted plans to assault the tower. They are ready to fight, ch'r'ai.

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_9.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_9.text: We could sift the missing artefact from the tower's ashes, if you would give us -
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_9.context: NodeContext: she is interrupted at the end of this sentence

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_13.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gish turn to look at the inquisitor in fear. NodeContext: his words have a soft menace to them.

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_0.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_0.text: Find the Astral Prism, Therezzyn - my patience falters.

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_2.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_2.context: InternalNodeContext: addressed to the other gitthynaki

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The githyanki look from the captain to the inquisitor, unsure of what to do

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_7.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_7.text: Do as she says. She remains your kith'rak.
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: The templar begins to leave

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_5.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: W'wargaz turns back to deliver this line, before continuing to turn and leave

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The captain scowls, and moves towards the device on the wall, her hand reaching back to retrieve its key (this will be concluded in gameplay)

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_11.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar_11.text: The latest patrol have not returned. I'm sorry, I -

AD_CaptainOrdersToCloseDoor_0.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_CaptainOrdersToCloseDoor_0.text: Shut those doors - this is not a public forum.
AD_CaptainOrdersToCloseDoor_0.context: NodeContext: Snappy, angry; loud enough for someone to hear on the other side of the room

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_2.text: This place is even more foreboding than the rest of the crèche.

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_0.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_0.text: I agree, it'll be good to get out of this place.

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_3.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_3.text: This Inquisitor sounds like a real piece of work. Do you think he'll answer our questions?

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_1.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_1.text: It's never been that simple before, I don't know why it would be now.

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_4.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar_4.text: All this fear of an inquisitor. He'd better be worth it.
